alert.note: Alert for Labette (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 4:35AM CDT until August 05 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Labette, Neosho and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 435 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training thunderstorms moving over the same areas. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parsons, Oswego, Thayer, Altoona, Galesburg, Labette, Lake Parsons, Dennis and South Mound.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
